question: 嫁ぐ
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>bride</kanji> and the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to marry</vocabulary>, because you can't really "to bride" someone.
sourceReadingMnemonic: Imagine you're getting married to a valley girl. You're all like. Hey, I'm gonna marry you! And she's all like <reading>Tots</reading> (<ja>とつ</ja>), we gonna get, like, married! Imagine her saying more "tots" things (tots = short for totally in valley girl speak, at least in my imagination).
